intro: Plethiandra beccariana, commonly known as the beccarian plethiandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its family.
